how big is the hdd?
is it the same size?
the hard drives will all be big enough (min 180gb) but of differing sizes and one will even have RAID
you can you use dd but it'll take quite a while, partimage is a great choice, not sure how it'll work with raid though

not really size doesnt matter, only that the the partition that you have currently setup on the image has to fit on the smallest hdd on all the clones, ie master hdd should be smaller than that of the clone

thats perfect, will more than comfortably fit on the smallest HD. My aim is to have the "/" partition be 25gb (4-5gb used) and the rest /home. Would the tools Titan8990 mentioned earlier (dd, partimage, clonezilla) be the first place to start?

dd would probably be simplest, it copies byte by byte, but can be a pain to clone, you have to go around with master hdd and hook it up to each of the slaves, or you can make an image and dd it through nfs or samba(you'll have to boot clones into livecds)
partimage has extensive network support, and is faster since it doesnt copy empty space on the hdd, but can be a little tricky to learn/use
clonezilla looks sweet
can clone up to 40 computers simultaneously

it all depends on your network connection, sure you can clone 40 comps, but its gonna be mad slow, im judging from my experience with ghost, a 40gb partition clones in about 40 minutes over 100mbps with about 20 computers going, 25 with 2
